sentence.Network_en: As people grow older they generally become less dexterous.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着年龄的增长，人通常会变得不再那么手巧。

sentence.Network_en: He carried the others off their feet, glib, dexterous, voluble.
sentence.Network_cn: 他叫大家发起狂来,讲得口若悬河, 伶俐乖巧, 滔滔不绝.

sentence.Network_en: The manager was dexterous in [ at ] handling his staff.
sentence.Network_cn: 那位经理善于运用 [ 调配 ] 他属下的职员.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'mentally adroit, clever'): from Latin dexter 'on the right' + -ous

entry.def: Someone who is dexterous is very skilful and clever with their hands.

example.ex: As people grow older they generally become less dexterous.
example.tran: 随着年龄的增长，人通常会变得不再那么手巧。
指法纯熟的布鲁斯钢琴演奏者

means.word_mean: 1. skillful in physical movements; especially of the hands;

sentences.sentence: "dexterous of hand and inventive of mind"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ambi二+dextrous=dexterous[adj.灵巧的,熟练的]→两手都是右手[都很灵巧]
dexter右边+ous……的→右手一般比左手灵活
